alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 10:54PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 100 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1054 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Clear Creek, Van Bibber Creek, Ralston Creek, Walnut Creek, Little Dry Creek, Big Dry Creek, Coal Creek, Rock Creek and Tucker Gulch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Lakewood, Arvada, western Westminster, southwestern Broomfield, Wheat Ridge, Golden and Rocky Flats.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, highways and underpasses. Additionally, country roads, farmlands along the banks of creeks, and other low lying areas are subject to flooding.
